website_summaries.verdict: The Chromebook Flip is one of the most flexible models available — the 360° hinge lets you adjust to any angle you want, and it has high-end features like WiFi 6 support.
pros: The super-thin bezels maximize the screen real estate gorgeously
It’s got plenty of ports for peripherals
cons: The Intel i3 CPU is definitely solid, but power users may prefer a Chromebook with a more powerful i5 or i7 chip

customer_reviews.title: Use Crostini? This is your next Chromebook.
customer_reviews.text: Real damn fast, and nearly perfect. The processor is a battery hog so one star for that, I haven't been getting more than 6-7 hours in a charge which is so much worse than the Pixelbook Go it's replacing. Still, the keyboard and touchpad are solid, and the screen (while not super bright) is pretty nice. If you're a Crostini person this Chromebook is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Romeo

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Premium Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: The Asus c436 chromebook is a chromebook that has the storage, memory, and processor to do pretty much anything that you throw at it. I purchased the $999 model with 512 gb of storage and a whopping 16gb of memory with an i5 processor. The screen is probably about 280 to 290 nits...with great color saturation. I use linux, android, and web apps and they all work well. I would definitely recommend this machine over any of the others out there. The fan rarely kicks on and the machine is thin, light and does not give off very much heat. If you want a premium chromebook that will handle anything that you throw at it. Look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Stark

customer_reviews.title: This Chromebook Is Really Fast With WiFi 6
customer_reviews.text: I use this Chromebook as my everyday machine and I like it very much. I have an ASUS AX router so I am using WiFi 6 for the C436 connection at 1200 Mbps and it's screaming fast. It's lightweight, trim, great screen resolution and the battery lasts all day. I have read some complaints about the keyboard and I don't use the back light feature but the keypad feels fine to me. I love all the RAM (16G) and the i5 quad core processor plus the 512G storage gives me plenty of room for multimedia storage. The sound is also quite good for such a small unit. Bottom line, I have three Chromebooks and this is by far my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: David Newman

customer_reviews.title: My first "premium" Chromebook and it exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant after seeing some reviews that dinged this computer for the screen and battery life, but did not encounter any problems. The screen is bright and clear enough for indoor and outdoor use, and I have used it for over 8 hours and still had over 30% battery remaining. (Of course, this varies with use, and the Chromebook's own estimate of remaining time is wildly variable, but I can count on about 10% battery usage per hour.)
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kennelly

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: Looks beautiful. Nice and light. My daughter will be using this for high school this fall. Love that it comes with a sleek case . Giving 4 stars instead of 5 only because seems a bit pricey (cold almost get a Mac for this price—and I am a Mac guy), but overall very happy so far. Will update if any issues (or if found that this s/b 5 stars).
customer_reviews.author: Scott K

customer_reviews.title: Touchscreen does not work, fingerprint not activated
customer_reviews.text: The touchscreen worked when I got this computer 10 days ago, all of the sudden it stopped working, I was able to reset it once, but after that it went off again and I was not able to get it to work even after several resets and powerwash. The fingerprint key does not work either. I contacted ASUS and the representative did not have any response about my problem, simply told me the best option for me is to return the machine. That's what I'm doing.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Sinisterra

customer_reviews.title: Great Chromebook, except for the awful camera
customer_reviews.text: An excellent product overall, let down only by it's absolutely appalling camera. Truly, the worst camera on any smart device I've owned. Why you'd put such effort into a design, spec it out with high quality components, and then finish it with a camera that belongs on a $100 tablet is beyond me.
customer_reviews.author: Holdenitdown

customer_reviews.title: Constantly crashes
customer_reviews.text: I like the look of this laptop, I like the keyboard contrary to some reviews, however my main issue is that it constantly crashes. I’ve had this laptop for two months and every five minutes it will crash whether it’s overheating, just turned on, or full battery. I’m not sure if it’s just my laptop or a malfunction on multiple others, but I’m very disappointed because I spent a lot of money on it to use for online school.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity G.

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Don't recommend this to anybody I received a used chromebook and scratched the screen starts to go dark during my son's school class bad quality very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: adalberto

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. works great, clarity of images superb.
customer_reviews.text: Light, awesome screen, buttons work great just the right amount of feel.worked immediately out of the box no problem.
customer_reviews.author: TJK

customer_reviews.title: 問題真多...  have a lot of problem😵
customer_reviews.text: 藍牙功能不能使用😵 螢幕需要非常用力才能觸控😵 沒有100GB google one 我已經向google查詢... the Bluetooth function cannot use😵 the touch screen Very hard to use 😵 do not provide 100GB Google one 😵 I was inquire in Google
customer_reviews.author: Ikkikwong

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine.
customer_reviews.text: A little expensive all things considered but a nice laptop.
customer_reviews.author: WillGetITDone

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the Operating system is compatible with your college system before buying it.
customer_reviews.text: Loved it but it wasn't compatible with my college operating system 😭
customer_reviews.author: Robin Howell

customer_reviews.title: Device stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Device stopped working after 8 weeks. Best option ASUS warranty could do for me was to send it in for repair. Not happy that I spent $999.99 on a chromebook that stopped working after 8 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Penman

customer_reviews.title: Great definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 12 yr old and we love it. Perfect for Digital learning.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica vega

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Read Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I returned this in frustration. The advertised "Super Bright" keyboard was NOT bright at all. In a way, there is a bright backlight that peeks out from below the edges of the keys. Very little light makes it out through the letters on the keys. The keys are dim and unreadable. Even with the backlight turned off, the tiny font of the keys combined with the metallic reflective surface of the keys makes it still hard to read. It makes the beautiful small bezel screen irrelevant.
customer_reviews.author: Dave F

customer_reviews.title: Received one that had many issues.
customer_reviews.text: Had issues right from the start with it. When I hit the number 1, it would type 13428709. Eventually got it to actually type 1. Got it fully setup for my mom who was going to be using it and then it happened again and this time when i rebooted i couldn't get any numbers or backspace to work again which means I couldn't unlock the computer either. Did a powerwash and the issue with the numbers remained. Was every number but 5 & 6. Worked with their support who was helpful but took a lot of time to get exactly where I got in less time. Returning this!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Do Not  Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I waited to buy this. Purchased as soon as Amazon had them in stock. I purchased the product replacement plan. I haven't used this nearly as much thought I would. The touchscreen would intermittently not respond. The touchscreen has completely went out. I tried to make a claim with my Asurion which will not let me make a claim until my Asus warranty is up. After searching online I have found this is a common issue. I reached out to Asus and it will take more than two weeks for them to repair it. Do yourself a favor and get something other than this Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3rd unit received - Bluetooth did not work
customer_reviews.text: Update - recieved 3rd unit, first thing I tried was bluetooth and it failed. Called Amazon support AND ASUS support. Could not get it to work. They suggested exchanging it for a replacement or sending it in for repairs. IF YOU DECIDE TO PURCHASE. PLEASE MAKE SURE IT ALL WORKS. I am awaiting my 3rd unit because the first 2 were faulty. The first unit's microphone and bluetooth did not work. The second units screen had a big black stripe as you can see in the picture. It was not dropped, mishandled, or misplaced. I want to like this product but my current impression is poor build quality. Very disappointed ASUS. Hoping someone there pays attention.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lemon - Broken keyboard and temerity to demand $15 to repair
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these units for our kids to use at school thanks to the strong recommendation of the Wirecutter. Unfortunately, one of the devices was a lemon with an entire keyboard row not responding to input. I understand that this is a regular occurrence with hardware, but most manufacturers would stand behind an immediately faulty device and replace it free of charge. Not ASUS, who demands the buyer purchase a $15 shipping label and wait weeks for repair. Not a company I will do business with again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Stamos

customer_reviews.title: Decent performance
customer_reviews.text: Screen quality is good Speed is fast biggest complaint is lousy wi-fi connection. My router is in other room less then 25 ft away but this Asus always loses connection or tells me I have medium connection. Every other device in same room stays connected and strong connection. Sometimes it is a day or more before I can get it to reconnect making it useless to use for anything. Bought this because I was tired of lousy Windows 10 & my HP computer. Seems this Asus is a lemon too. Would only recommend if using right in front of your modem or router or direct connection via hard wire.
customer_reviews.author: Russells loaded apperral

customer_reviews.title: Terribly Disappointed! -Broken day one.
customer_reviews.text: I disliked this product for the fact the Chromebook wouldn’t turn on (or stay on. Straight out package computer had issues. It turned on for 1 hr when I received it, but never came back in again. Wouldn’t accept a change either. We called Asus and all to no avail. Terribly disappointed in Amazon for selling me this garbage as “like new”. Refurbished. I am returning immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Always

customer_reviews.title: Very happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I researched the heck out of these chromebooks before buying this one. This was my first one of these and I was concerned that it would be cheaply made or be less useful than the higher end laptops I've been buying for years. Didn't have any prior experience with Asus either so not sure about them. Boy, am I ever happy with this Chromebook. Really good customer experience, great product at a fair price. I will never buy another laptop again (and goodbye forever to Windows and OS).
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: flashing, glitchy screen and no serial number on the product
customer_reviews.text: We've had this computer for 6 months for my son's remote schooling, and for the last month or two it's had intermittent flashing and glitching of the screen. Now it's got a crack too. It should be within warranty, but since there's no serial number on the machine (was it removed by Trendy Tech?) there's nothing we can do about it. Just spent a precious 90 min of my workday (which home with two kids remote schooling) trying to sort this out with zero results. So frustrated. This will be our third school laptop this year.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Brody

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of Chrome books and the affordability. My last ASUS flip worked well, even after the cover broke. That was the only disappointment. I am hoping that was a fluke. I am not using the flip feature on this ASUS for that reason. I do love the portability of Chrome as a whole. The ease of saving things in the cloud has been a feature that has always attracted me, as I have gone through so many computers both PC and MAC.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wolfsong

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, amazing design, superb value
customer_reviews.text: My new ASUS Chromebook Flip C434 replaced a Chromebook purchased in 2013. I had read everything I could find on the new Chromebooks, and I am so happy I chose the ASUS 434. The size and weight of the Chromebook are deceptive. Though the exterior is all metal -- smooooooth and elegant, and the screen is 14", it is very lightweight and compact. The case does not creak or flex when picked up (either opened or closed), and the screen is clear and nearly edge-to-edge. It gives results that are surprising for a smaller sized Chromebook. I am very pleased with this purchase. Actually, I am very pleasantly surprised at the value and options for the price.
customer_reviews.author: preacherlady

customer_reviews.title: 85% awesome, keyboard lighting is flaw
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself an expert on computers, and save for the keyboard backlighting, I like pretty much everything about it. Bought for kindergartener. The problem, like other reviewer’s have stated, is that when ambient light, or light from the screen, reflects off the shiny silver keyboard, the inadequately designed back lighting system can’t compete. Once you turn the brightness up on the keyboard (alt +screen brightness up) it becomes a bit more usable, but I have overhead lighting turned on for my daughter which remedies the floor I have overhead lighting turned on for my daughter, which remedies the flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Robert DeGutis

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend. Random shut off.
customer_reviews.text: The size, battery life, speed- all things that I love about this laptop. HOWEVER... after persistent troubleshooting over the past year, the laptop continues to spontaneously reboot at least once every 1-2hrs of use (frequently about every 20-30min). It is extremely frustrating. Luckily, I use Google (docs, sheets, etc.) for my work, so everything is automatically saved and I don't lose work. If the rebooting issue didn't exist, I would highly recommend this laptop. But that is not the case, and my recommendation is Do Not Purchase. Save yourself the irritation and purchase a laptop that will stay on and useful while you are actively using it.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I ordered a laptop and then I realized that it is a chrome I did not know how to use it so I read the settings and you get used to it. I also called the customer service and they spent a lot of time on the phone guiding me on how to use it, I love it. The keyboard does not make any noise, touch screen is perfect. It is kind of difficult to see the letters in the keyboard sometimes But you just have to find the right position. Great purchase. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: Once pass the querky marking of the keyboard you have one beautiful machine.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Another poster has gone into detail and all i can say is ditto! Another poster noted the odd marking/coloring of the keys on the keyboard. I agree with him, but he consider it a showstopper - I don't. The Chrome OS has a different keyboard layout, i would past that warning along - If you are a hunt-and-peck typist unfamilar with the new layout, and have to hit the ground rolling, you are going to be very annoyed for a couple of weeks.. Smile. Luckily I have a lot of experience with multiple devices and diferent keyboards so a couple of days of touch-typing i never looked back.
customer_reviews.author: Ralphy

customer_reviews.title: Backlit keys are worthless/ not compatible with zoom
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wish the keys were black, even though they are backlit, it is a worthless feature if you still can't see the keys. With my evening lamp on the symbols blend perfectly with the keys so that it looks like a faceless button. Other than that I really like it, I've never had a chromebook so still learning. Update: Not compatible with zoom, everybody uses zoom, I will be returning this grrrrrr
customer_reviews.author: Dina Marshall

customer_reviews.title: I love this computer! (Pictures I have shows the computer with an exterior cover and keyboard cover)
customer_reviews.text: Using this computer to type this review right now! I initially wanted another Windows tablet, but I live off Google suites. My fiance convinced me to try a chromebook as it would fulfill almost all my needs. I've been an avid ASUS user mainly because of look of the computer. They have also been very reliable with very few issues for me. This particular computer has a great battery life and light weight. Looks sleek with a fast start up. If you're looking for a computer for everyday work, or even college courses, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Pegz L

customer_reviews.title: Screen Problems on First One
customer_reviews.text: I have not had this Chromebook long enough to review anything other than functionality. I really like all of the features. I will give it five stars if it has longterm reliability. The first one I bought had a screen problem within a week of use. Amazon replaced it quickly. My experience in general is it appears computer companies have decided to the let the customers perform the "burn-in" for the computers and let "infant mortality" happen in the hands of the end user vs. being part of the manufacture process.
customer_reviews.author: Budha

customer_reviews.title: Best looking and most expensive doorstop we've ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: We were excited to open the brand new Chromebook. It looked great, and the good news is that most of the keys on the keyboard worked. The bad news is that the dozen or so that didn't work were ones we needed too. Support is nice, but it'll take about a month to return for repair. They won't send a new one out. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Stay away- bluetooth doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The bluetooth doesn't work at all on the ASUS C434T. I tried connecting to several different devices and had the same issue- as soon as the device paired it disconnected from bluetooth, After several calls with an Amazon representative and then with an Asus representative, it was determined that it was a hardware issue with the device. I received brand new replacement ASUS C434T. Again, the same issue! It is literally impossible to connect a device through bluetooth. Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Classy Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Chromebook. I received it two days earlier than expected in Japan. I needed the Chromebook's OS and keyboard to be in English. I have been using it in my 7th, 8th, and 9th-grade classes, which lasted for ten hours. My Chromebook has a 4GB memory, 64GB internal drive. I added a 256GB micro SD card. It is a bit pricy but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Becketo

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy to replace lousy school issued Chromebook.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a much less expensive version of surface pro and much better touch screen and 14” screen for my son’s school than the 10” beaten up one we got from school. It’s perfect for him for a better Chromebook without breaking the bank on getting him another MacBook Pro that he will destroy within a year. Very good quality all around for less that $400
customer_reviews.author: Madam Yes

customer_reviews.title: Great Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Chromebook. It is replacing a Samsung Plus 2, which had a plastic case. The hinge eventually pulled away from the screen, and the track pad was sticky and it lasted less than a year. This has an aluminum body, larger screen, faster processor, more memory! Just a great computer. This feels a bit heavier than the Samsung, but not too much. It is very solid! The one thing I am not crazy about is the minimal bezel. It does allow a 14" screen in a 13" space, but it is too easy to touch the edge of the screen, especially in tablet mode. Otherwise, I can't find anything to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Charging function failed after 3 days use
customer_reviews.text: Product worked for a few days very nicely but charging failed and the Chromebook is simply dead. Had to return and purchase a new Chromebook. Upgrade is expected Tuesday. Hopefully thus new Asus will not fail.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Completely failure under 8 months - Warranty scam
customer_reviews.text: The Chromebook completed died one day out of the blue after owning it for less than 8 months. It would not charge or power on. After following all troubleshooting tips, and even purchasing a new power adapater, I sent it in for repair under warranty. Asus claims the warranty was void because of superficial damage completely unrelated to the problem. The customer service rep twisted herself into a pretzel to try to justify the decision and gave me no option to dispute it. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a new Chromebook every year for the last 5 years. The Asus flip C434 is replacing my HP 2-1 14 inch. The Asus is also 14 inches but thanks to the tiny bezels it feels like a 13 inch. The screen is amazing, the speakers are very decent and the processor even with 4GB RAM is snappy. Wonderful keyboard. Overall awesome experience. Highly recommended. Plays very nice with my Nokia 7.2 and I use the smart-lock feature on the phone to unlock the Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: Mikeyt1818

customer_reviews.title: An outstanding buy by any measure.
customer_reviews.text: Quality chromebooks are an outstanding computing value. This is one of them. If you're new to buying a computer: On any laptop check the keyboard, screen, and battery. The CPU in any mid-range or better system will have VERY little to do with your satisfaction. Using only an SSD for the hard drive is much more important to speed. Get a system with the screen, battery life, and keyboard, you like best. Fast, well made, materially better security than most consumer systems. This is a winner in every regard.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua A Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Chromebook, but it's fast. Screen is very nice, although I'm returning it for a couple of reasons. The border around the screen is too narrow, it makes it very hard to be in tablet mode without accidentally brushing the screen. Also, the keyboard is fine (blacklighting is poor though) and the touch pad is atrocious. I really wanted a laptop I don't even need a mouse for, but this trackpad sucks. That was the main thing I wanted in my chromebook. So back it goes
customer_reviews.author: Alex Anselme

customer_reviews.title: Nice little chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I like how the screen folds so you can stand it up in a "V". The touch screen is always a plus and the keys of the keyboard are easy to use. Cons: The keyboard is such that the backlit keys are difficult to see in the dark because the keyboard is silver instead of black, but I just purchased a silicone cover in black which says it allows the backlite to shine through, so we'll see how it works. And when the computer is being used as a tablet I haven't figured out how to use the touch screen like you would a mouse when choosing the emoticons on the "like" feature on Facebook.
customer_reviews.author: Kaelin51

customer_reviews.title: REALLY BAD KEYBOARD
customer_reviews.text: OVERALL THIS IS A QUALITY LAPTOP AND I THINK ANYONE WOULD LOVE IT HAD THEY USED A LITTLE SENSE IN THE LIGHTED KEYBOARD. IT IS JUST IMPOSSIBLE TO READ THE LETTERS AND NUMBERS. I AM 87 YEARS OLD WITH LIMITED VISION AND THE LIT KEYBOARD IS REALLY NEEDED AND FOR THAT REASON I RETURNED THE LAPTOP. I REALLY WANTED THE COMPUTER AND HATED HAVING TO RETURN IT. WOULD BUY IT AGAIN IF THEY WERE TO RE-DO THEIR BAD KEYBOARD.
customer_reviews.author: dew

customer_reviews.title: Great price point and laptop!
customer_reviews.text: So far I’m really liking this chrome laptop. It’s been a learning curve from the traditional desktop and our older laptop. However I bought it for its size, touch screen, and I like that the screen can rotate. I’m mainly using this for school purposes and so far so good in meeting those needs. I’m very simple when it comes to electronics so I can’t offer any specs etc, but it operates fast and picture quality is really nice. Price point on this is excellent too!
customer_reviews.author: TylerandJune

customer_reviews.title: Touch Screen Stops Responding and Rebooting becomes necessary
customer_reviews.text: Frustrated at how often the touch screen functionality freezes and then i have to reboot in order to get the touch screen to work again. Also, when the underside of the keyboard gets held with one hand, it triggers some keyboard shortcuts that change things on the screen!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Iversen

customer_reviews.title: Free 3 Months of Stadia; Stadia Not Available On This Device
customer_reviews.text: Product description says this device comes with 3 months of Stadia (Google's game streaming service). Unfortunately, Stadia is not available for this device. Picture evidence included, if Amazon doesn't nix it. 2 stars off for false information in product description. Casing feels solid. Handled everything I've thrown at it quickly. Sceen is clear. Touch is responsive. 8 hours, give or take, battery life under my normal use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Quality is great!
customer_reviews.text: Really good Laptop the quality is excellent the touchscreen is good though kind of takes getting used to at the beginning the screen is the biggest perk. The only critique is that the speaker is kind of weak, not the worst sounding but definitely not the best. Overall a bang for your buck. Best chrome I've ever owned and I've bought quite a few!
customer_reviews.author: Tchalla Campbell

customer_reviews.title: An awesome machine with one issue I couldn't get past.
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about this machine except the keyboard as others have said. The problem for me is the light letters on light keys. That is partly my fault - I don't type well and need to see the keys. It's nearly impossible to see the letters on the keys in most conditions. My son who types well said he would have never noticed the issue with the keys. I had to return this machine for this reason. If you don't need to see what keys you are hitting, this is the one to have.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Lacks any Quality Assurance
customer_reviews.text: Well let's start with the fact I've had the thing for less then 6 months and it's already broken! The power supply provided powers my other usb C devices but not the actual chromebook. The rubber feet on the bottom fell off within a month, the keyboard is terrible with silver caps and white backlight (good luck seeing the keys) the bezel on the bottom was cracked when I opened the box. Find a different device
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two flaws keep it from a perfect score
customer_reviews.text: For the money the screen quality, keyboard feel, speed, and build quality are all great, but there are two flaws that keep me from giving a full 5 stars. The keyboard backlight coupled with the silver keys make it difficult to see key letters in the day time. The workaround is to turn the keyboard backlight off in the daylight but that is an annoyance. The other flaw is that the laptop is actually uncomfortable to place on your lap because of the hinge design. There are some uncomfortable edges and protrusions that make it so I would only use it on a desktop for extended periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amadeo Q

customer_reviews.title: So slick and solid--I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This computer is awesome. The screen is beautiful and responsive, the volume is great, the brightness is great, and I love the ability to freak people out by turning the keyboard all the way around. I am especially pleased with the solid and high quality feel of the keyboard itself. True, the backlit solution doesn't work that great and the white letters are hard to see against the nearly white grey keys. But the feel and feedback of the keyboard itself is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Gerke

customer_reviews.title: loving my new chrome book
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I ask (zoom mtgs, email, webpages, Youtube) quickly & without a hitch. Love the style, seems solid but very light weight. Nice balance of size - small enough for my day bag, large enough to easily see screen. Keyboard can be awkward when long typing - I think some of the bottom keys are too sensitive as I seem to accidentally hit them fairly often. Battery life excellent. Touch screen very sensitive (in a great way).
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing balanced laptop with Android apps and Linux
customer_reviews.text: ChromeOS has come a long way, and this hardware exemplify the perfect blend: enough performance, memory, storage, not too big, not too small all at a very reasonable price. And now that ChromeOS (has for a while) supports Android apps, and Linux (including apps), I'm not sure the 2-4x cost of either a bloatware infected Windows (where the bloatware will soon be swapped for virus infections) machine or an over-priced locked-in ecosystem MacBook is worth it. I switched long-time ago from Windows to Mac, but have been disappointed with Apple's progress and switched to this Chromebook. I have been pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Safari John

customer_reviews.title: Must have received a bad one.
customer_reviews.text: great Chromebook but 4 weeks into it the screen is acting sporadically ,constantly jumpy ,flickering,with random webb pages just poping up over what iam looking at .Iam not sure what the problem is but it has one. Update !...it was a malware virus.Elimanated the bad apps and now it's all beautiful again🙂.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard is invisible.
customer_reviews.text: The screen is great. Truly outstanding quality for streaming movies But the keyboard is virtually invisible making typing ridiculously difficult and error prone. I regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Mass

customer_reviews.title: Nice Chromebook, But WIFI connectivity is a big problem
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this Chromebook is fine, or even better. Except the WIFI. I have to be on top of the router to get a strong connection. A few feet away is medium. And more than that weak, or not even able to connect. I have several Chromebooks, from entry level(Acer R11) to premium(Pixelbook), and this has BY FAR, the worst WIFI connectivity of any of them. If you have a chance to get a similarly or even less expensive, similarly featured, HP Chromebook x360 14-14" FHD Touch - Core i3-8130u - 8GB - 64GB eMMC, that is frequently on sale here or elsewhere, I'd strongly recommend that chromebook over this one.
customer_reviews.author: Morefaves

customer_reviews.title: Best combination for technical work and pleasure
customer_reviews.text: First chromebook after having bought many other personal computers in my long life. I wanted this to run specific Android apps, which it does brilliantly. I was pleased to learn how much more I could do with the beta Linux environment. I also enjoy watching movies, using the touch screen, typing on the back lit keyboard and connecting devices using the USB-A port and dual USB-C ports. Speed, battery life and features have totaled up to much more than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Software techie

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard backlighting is big negative
customer_reviews.text: Very nice in most ways, so it is hard to understand how they failed so miserably with keyboard backlight design. In most lighting conditions it makes the keys less visible rather than more. The glare of light leaking out around the edges of the keys drowns out the lighted characters. Just plain poor design that apparently was not tested before production. The easy solution is to just turn off the backlight -- it is just a nuisance to do so every time one boots up. FYI -- backlight brightness is controlled by alt/screen brightness buttons.
customer_reviews.author: DenInRV

customer_reviews.title: Great Premium Chromebook!
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY like Chromebooks and won’t be without one anymore. My mother’s iPad was old and not receiving updates, so I gave her my old Asus Chromebook and shopped around for a new one for myself. I really wanted another flip Chromebook, but I loved the lighted keys on my MacBook Pro, so I only looked for Chromebooks with lighted keys. This Asus C434T checked off all the boxes for what I wanted, and it’s fast and of excellent build quality, all at a good price for a premium Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: B. ANDREWS

customer_reviews.title: Good product with lots of room for improvements
customer_reviews.text: I am a tiny bit disappointed. Don't get me wrong it's still a beautiful machine, but I've encountered a problem within 2 days of using it. When it's in tablet mode, I've noticed that it glitches every now and then. It's really annoying. Sometimes it'll zoom in on itself. The touch screen may be a little unresponsive. So I just power it down and then back on an it'll be fine. I've googled it up and it seemed like it's happened to a few other people. And they said to do a master reset or something like that. So I'll do that soon and hopefully I'll get some good results and I'll edit my review
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Manu

customer_reviews.title: Touch Screen is Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The computer works pretty well, but the touchscreen randomly stops working. There isn't really a point to having a 2 in 1 device if it can't be used in tablet mode.
customer_reviews.author: Kunle

customer_reviews.title: Good computer, slight glitches
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful computer and wonderful small beveled screen for price. However, experienced glitches within the first month and returned it because I was worried about it getting worse in the future. Other than that I loved the screen, ability to run google apps, and keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Excellent build quality Thin screen bezels Fairly bright screen Backlit keyboard Cons: While the screen is bright, text isn’t as sharp as you’d expect at this price Backlit keyboard is nice but makes it difficult to read because the keys are silver instead of black. Overall I feel if this were priced at 400-450 it would be a great value. I expect more at 599.00
customer_reviews.author: B2

customer_reviews.title: Touchscreen Freeze!
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built, great look, BUT... the touchscreen constantly freezes. Ironically, I had to restart right in the middle of this review! I am returning it in favor of the Acer Spin 13.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great on the road computer
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up to take with me on my travels as my Dell died on me recently and I don't like using my work laptop in the hotel and I am not taking my gaming computer on the road (cost for baggage would be astronomical). What I like about this is I can watch movies on the flight in tablet mode. Mess with it in tent mode on the bed listening to music and the such. And use it as a an android gaming computer (or a windows gaming computer with Shadow.tech). It is the perfect combination of sleek and power. And people just think it looks cool.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Seems ok but somewhat disappointed because Amazon packaging was terrible
customer_reviews.text: It is about a month since I purchased this laptop for my daughter. Everyone is rushing to buy one for their kid due to COVID-19 remote learning this fall. Anyway, when I got the package, the laptop was sliding within. Yup. No famed wrapping or filler to cushion the laptop. Just....sliding around....the machine, thank goodness...works...except for the bracket key which sometimes gets stuck. Anyway, I kept it because there is a shortage of laptops and I am in a bind so as long as the laptop works, and it is a great laptop, by the way, I guess we’ll chug along. But Amazon shipping messed up.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Hom

customer_reviews.title: Great chromebook with some exceptions
customer_reviews.text: Very sleek size, clean and minimal. Performance is great. The downside is you can't have any other electronics like your phone or anything metal by or on laptop. It causes a screen glitch out when in contact with any metal. This seems irreversible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Asus is all show and no go
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old Asus laptop hard drive took a dump so I purchased this gorgeous 2 in 1 as a replacement. I hesitated BIG TIME because of a non-feature common to both laptops. For 6 years I hated my Asus because it had NO CAPS LOCK INDICATOR of any type. Well you guessed it! None on this Chromebook. How dense is Asus? I will never take a chance on another Asus. Also the keyboard is abysmal. You can't see the characters on the keys because of the poor choice of shine of the keys. Asus blew a great opportunity to create a frigging awesome Chromebook. Either problem noted was enough for me to return this beautiful Book.
customer_reviews.author: MENACHEM MORDECHAI

customer_reviews.title: ASUS is perfect 💕
customer_reviews.text: When my daughter needed a computer for middle school, I found the computer she always wanted. When we first got it, it was perfect! There was one problem though, when she was watching YouTube the internet kinda started to be kinda slow. That was pretty much the only problem, but the internet used to load a bit slower than usual, but it got better. The more she used the computer, the more energy the computer got. My daughter loves, and takes care of her computer. I suggest that anyone should buy any computer on Amazon, and the quality and packaging deserves a 5 out of 5!
customer_reviews.author: Srini

customer_reviews.title: Black screen - unable to resolve even with tech support
customer_reviews.text: Loved my new Chromebook initially, but after a long flight I was never able to get power to the screen again - after an hour on the phone with Amazon tech support and another hour with ASUS tech support, ASUS advised that I send it back. Not sure that I will reorder.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Be aware the defect of this Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: DOA, Dead on ARRIVAL with attached message Missing chrome os.....I did a research and recovered unit, it dose run but just few hour, it came back again. Be aware, do you want to reload your OS a few hours? When it's running, it looks ok as the other reviews. I have contacted Amazon three times and Asus two times for requesting replacement, but rejected. I have to return for refund. It seems Asus did not know this issue and their tech service has no idea of what this about.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Chan

customer_reviews.title: Battery Issues just after First Year
customer_reviews.text: I liked this computer just fine until the battery stopped working at month 13. It won’t even register as present in the computer. I contacted ASUS, but they said they wouldn’t replace anything as I was past the 12 month warranty. Their proposed solution was to mail it in for a non refundable $60 diagnosis, and then charge me the cost to fix whatever is wrong with it. I’ve decided to simply shop for a new computer. Up to this point, it seemed to be a great product.
customer_reviews.author: BDumm

customer_reviews.title: Well-built, solid and fast. I love it.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I miss my 11 inch Asus C100. The 14 inch is of course bigger and heavier. Better graphics and definitely faster. I wish the keyboard letters were darker because when backlit, they are hard to see. Still, I do love my Chromebook, and this one is beautiful and solidly built.
customer_reviews.author: ljlewis

customer_reviews.title: Wish the volume worked
customer_reviews.text: I read review after review on this laptop before purchasing and not one told me how bad the volume is. My cell phone volume is louder at half volume. My husband ‘s iPad is louder. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Carina

customer_reviews.title: Light yet solid
customer_reviews.text: With Chromebooks (I've had a couple), I find it sooo nice to be rid of Windows. Chromebooks come set up to run (free) programs... I use 'Docs' (to dictate or type reports) and 'Sheets' (for spreadsheet purposes), daily at work. And I find it runs all my cloud and internet based accounts (over 100) just fine. This particular Asus C434 is by far the best (and newest) Chromebook I've seen or used to date. I don't know what more to say than it is simply the best.
customer_reviews.author: pwrlftr

customer_reviews.title: This is my second one.
customer_reviews.text: Once you get used to new keystrokes, Chromebooks are fast and handy. What I like about this Asus model is the battery life is looong. What I dislike is that the silver keyboard negates any benefit of the internally lit keys. In a dimly lit room, the screen reflects onto the keyboard and overcomes or washes out the internal key lights. Reclining with the Chromebook on my chest, they don't show up at all. If I had it to do over, I'd get black.
customer_reviews.author: Sherlockzz

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, but constant quality issues kill the experience
customer_reviews.text: While we were initially excited about this Chromebook, we have since come to very much regret the purchase. We gave this Chromebook to our older child for school work, but not a day goes by without issues of the device freezing, connectivity issues, flickering issues, unresponsiveness, jank, audio and camera issues. This is definitely not a laptop you can setup and forget. It requires constant massaging to get working. We also purchased the much cheaper Chromebook Flip C214 from ASUS, and in comparison, it works like a charm. I recommend you either go for a cheaper model, or upgrade to a MacBook. This particular model I simply cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie Chicken

customer_reviews.title: One of the best Chromebooks on the market
customer_reviews.text: ASUS makes a fantastic Chromebook with this model C434. The touch screen is fantastic, along with the screen quality. The 2-In-One Tablet/Chromebook works well with the hinges being solid and screen movement being smooth. Android software works great, as well as ASUS firmware options. Definitely recommended for your first-year college students and beyond.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R.

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal laptop/tablet combo
customer_reviews.text: I've waited several months to write this review since it takes that long to fully appreciate the good and bad of any device (in my opinion). This is, by far, the best laptop/tablet I've ever owned. And I'm including multiple iPads and Mac books I've owned. It's fast, easy to use, and extremely light. It has a rugged yet very sleek build and rotates from laptop to tablet effortlessly. Highly recommend as an alternative to anything out there at a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Great for online meetings
customer_reviews.text: Despite what some reviews say, this Chromebook does have a microphone! Everything works well, the battery life perhaps could be better but we are using it almost exclusively for online meetings which i know drains the battery. Camera is OK, not fantastic, but good enough for video meetings. Boots up instantaneously and suffers none of teh WIndows maladies.
customer_reviews.author: Porsche owner

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box it was already impressive. It is thinner than my old tablet, has the same screen size as my old laptop and that flip screen...so perfect. I got this touch screen to push my husband into being more tech savvy. Not sure that will happen but I sure will enjoy this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Nicki

customer_reviews.title: Good laptop but takes getting used to
customer_reviews.text: I am only used to computers with Microsoft operating system and software. Chromebook is not the same. I was not aware till after I got the Chromebook. Have to learn how to use it. Need a cloud printer which I don't have so I can't print. Almost everything is done on the cloud. Laptop is more like a tablet that connects you to the cloud.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Chromebook!
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher and my students have Chromebooks. I wanted something I could carry around the class easily as a tablet to cast material to their devices as well as use as my own device. This fits the bill! (Of course, we haven't gone back to in person teaching yet, but it should work great when we do!)
customer_reviews.author: ishlen65

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great chromebook!
customer_reviews.text: Only the 1st day with the chromebook, switching from an older Samsung 3 that I loved but screen went out. Wanted something that was 2 in 1 and better specs. So far this Asus is really fast, great screen and looks nice. I don't like the weight, bright silver keys, makes it hard to see, the screen is hard to get open and the speaker quality is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua David Beck

customer_reviews.title: Junk!! No not buy..Keyboard dead in two months!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk, build quality is poor at best. Keyboard went to all hot keys, then did not work at all. I used the touch screen for a few days, then it failed.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great machine!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! No issues at all. You have to remember that it is not a windows machine and the limitations of a chromebook. It handles word, excel, and all other apps I throw at it. Boots lightning fast. If you use a stylus, find a decent one. Pay the few extra dollars and don't get frustrated thinking it is the computer. Great little work machine!
customer_reviews.author: BOB

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Packaged by Amazon - arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Amazon poorly packaged this item. It arrived in an outer box that was 3 times the size needed. One small amount of brown paper was placed on top. The item could freely bounce around all over the place. Upon testing, the unit looked ok but one of the speakers was fuzzy and not working well. I have returned the item for a replacement and submitted a compliant on the poor packaging by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: BWilson

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am so extremely impressed with this computer. I bought it for school and couldn't be happier with my purchase. It's suiting all my needs for my online college courses. It has plenty of internal storage to get me started and I'll just buy a hard drive when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi

customer_reviews.title: Best Laptop I've Ever Owned!!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with this Chromebook!! Very sleek look, beautiful display & the corner to corner screen is phenomenal, not to mention how fast this thing is. Thin, light weight, excellent battery life & more. I could go on & on about this laptop!! Highly recommend this product to anyone in the market for a high quality laptop.
customer_reviews.author: CaitlinP

customer_reviews.title: A quality product
customer_reviews.text: Was tired of MS and all the issues with updates, security & complicated OS. Chrome resolves that for me. This is a very good laptop. Had previously an ASUS with MS Vista, lasted me 8 years. This appears to be even better in quiality and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Lubo

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about this laptop but was instantly disappointed by the speed overall and the trackpad is super loud and feels cheap. The screen itself is pretty nice looking and the keyboard was decent. It started crashing from day one. It turned itself off (with full charge) multiple times during use. I found it crashing most often while using zoom or going live on facebook. Also, the speakers are HORRIBLE. I definitely encourage you to look elsewhere for a laptop at this price point. I gave in an bought a pixelbook go for a few hundred more. TOTALLY worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Thomson

customer_reviews.title: Where's the delete key?
customer_reviews.text: Nice little PC. Overall, I like it. It is hard to see the letters on the keys in daylight, they light up at night but you have to look from directly above to see the keys when the room light is on. I haven't figured out how to find the Task Manager yet since there is no Delete key (used to using Control Alt Delete).
customer_reviews.author: Kendal H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use Beautiful Chromebook!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this great chromebook. It is easy to use and the screen is very vivid and I also love the fact that is a touch screen. The only challenge was reading the keyboard in day light since the silver keys do not provide enough contrast to read the letters quickly. This was easily resolved with an inexpensive silicone keyboard cover sold on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: connectivity issues
customer_reviews.text: I love this chromebook, I really do, but it has had connectivity issues from day one. The bluetooth didn't work when I got it, so I returned it for repairs. When I got it back, it worked long enough for me to connect a mouse. It has a problem with the wifi, saying the signal is weak, when other devices have no problem. Because of the 'weak' wifi, it's slow. And of course, the bluetooth doesn't work (other than the mouse). What a dissappointment.
customer_reviews.author: T. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: One of The Best Chromebooks!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best Chromebooks you can buy. Really enjoying using this Chromebook. Great build quality, screen and keyboard. Extremely small screen Bezels makes for a large screen in a compact device. Great to have a built-in SD Card reader as well as 2 USB Type-C ports and 1 USB Type-A port. Haven't had to use a Dongle once. I'd recommend this Chromebook to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: William G.

customer_reviews.title: Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Bought a different brand and had terrible problems. The insurance covered a replacement. I bought this brand and so far it has been excellent. I don't use the touch screen as much, have a wireless mouse with no problems. Battery life has been very good, clear picture. Really pleased and would recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: David G. Damp

customer_reviews.title: Touch screen could be better
customer_reviews.text: I like this laptop a lot so far. It's easy to use, fast, and smooth. The laptop looks and feels nice. They keyboard keys itself have a strange texture but it's not a deal breaker. The only complaimt so far are the lack of touch screen sensitivity.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: WARNING! SEARCH 'BATTERY' 'BLACK SCREEN' ISSUES FOR THIS ASUS CHROMEBOOK
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in August and it stopped working in October. It would no longer take a charge. I tried all the hacks found on the web but none worked. I contacted ASUS and they said mail it to their repair shop in Idaho. I asked for a replacement to be mailed instead. Replacing a defective two month old device is apparently not something ASUS is capable of doing. A very long story of the worst customer service I have ever experienced has finally brought me to write my this my first Amazon review. Absolutely awful. Run, don't walk, as far away from ASUS as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Perry
